title: MODEL_VERSIONS view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This Information Schema view displays a row for each machine learning model version defined in the specified (or current) database.
Database to which the model version belongs.
Schema to which the model version belongs.
Model to which the model version belongs.
List of aliases of the model version.
Name of the role that owns the model version.
Date and time when model version was created.
Date and time when the model version was last updated.
Type of the model to which the model version belongs.
Version of Python required by the model version.
Language in which the model version is implemented.
User data of the model version.
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.
The view does not include model versions that have been dropped.
Retrieve the names of all model versions, functions, and the model they belong to, in the mydatabase database:
